page.title: 13FLORA AND FAUNA.
page.content: The area is well off for natural resources and especially so for plants and wildlife. On Caldy Hill there are nearly 120 different species of plants and flowers that have been identified. The wildlife consists mainly of animals such as badgers,foxes,rabbits, grey squirrels,grass snakes,lizards and many other species of animals and insects. One of the less savoury aspects of the wildlife are the problems that are being caused by visitors who are badger baiting.At the present time there is only one active badger set in the area and that is being closely watched by local conservation groups in the hope that it can be saved. Foxes are also quite numerous and often come into housing areas scavenging for food.
